DataElement.preferredDefinition: Unique identifier for patient specifically for MCL study.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A consortium consisting of independent, multi-disciplinary teams that undertake comprehensive molecular and cellular characterizations of tumor tissue, cell, and microenvironment components to distinguish screen-detected early lesions from interval and symptom-detected cancers._A living individual about whom an investigator conducting research obtains data through intervention or interaction with the individual or through identifiable private information.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Consortium for Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screen-Detected Lesions
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A consortium consisting of independent, multi-disciplinary teams that undertake comprehensive molecular and cellular characterizations of tumor tissue, cell, and microenvironment components to distinguish screen-detected early lesions from interval and symptom-detected cancers.

Concepts.longName: Consortium for Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screen-Detected Lesions
Concepts.definition: A consortium consisting of independent, multi-disciplinary teams that undertake comprehensive molecular and cellular characterizations of tumor tissue, cell, and microenvironment components to distinguish screen-detected early lesions from interval and symptom-detected cancers.

Property.preferredDefinition: A living individual about whom an investigator (whether professional or student) conducting research obtains data through intervention or interaction with the individual, or identifiable private information. Intervention includes both physical procedures by which data are gathered (for example, venipuncture) and manipulations of the subject or the subject's environment that are performed for research purposes. Interaction includes communication or interpersonal contact between investigator and subject. Private information includes information about behavior that occurs in a context in which an individual can reasonably expect that no observation or recording is taking place, and information which has been provided for specific purposes by an individual and which the individual can reasonably expect will not be made public (for example, a medical record). Private information must be individually identifiable (i.e., the identity of the subject is or may readily be ascertained by the investigator or associated with the information) in order for obtaining the information to constitute research involving human subjects. (Code of Federal Regulations, TITLE 45, PART 46, PROTECTION OF HUMAN SUBJECTS).

Concepts.definition: A living individual about whom an investigator conducting research obtains data through intervention or interaction with the individual or through identifiable private information.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 12/22/20 jk upd def to reflect revised MCL Participant ID format. 11/19/18 jk Released per PI/Maureen at Oct 2018 Steering Comm meeting 9/21/18 jk created for MCL specimen identifier to be used across MCL sub-groups.

ReferenceDocuments.name: MCL-PCA-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: MCL Participant Identifier - PCA Participant ID

ReferenceDocuments.name: MCL-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Format is MCL site number concatenated with patient number, for example MCL75_001 where site 75 is the UCSF/Esserman lab and 001 is the patient number.  Refer to the list of site IDs posted on the MCL portal.

DataElement.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElement.changeDescription: 11/17/21 mr Added CSI for MCL PCA breast; added ref doc.    9/21 mr added CSI for MCL lung, added ref doc per MCL DD. 9/1/21 mr added CSI for PCA Lung, added alt def, added Ref Doc to align with MCL DD. 7/22/21 jk added CSI for PCA Breast, Pancreas. 3/16/21 jk removed Genomic Core CSI; added to genomic candidate CSI.  2/25/21 jk Upd Reg Status per SME (KA) Clinical core review and approval.  12/22/20 jk classified in Clinical Core CSI.  6/4/20 jk added Genomic Core CSI.  1/21/20 jk removed Core CSI per MCL CDE lead.  2/14/19 jk AQT for MCL Breast.  1/28/19 jk released; AQT added for MCL PCA.  9/21/18 jk unique MCL subject/participant ID.  CDE can not be altered.
